Title: Requires insurance companies to reimburse all health care practitioners at the same rate for cervical cytology screening
Summary: Requires insurance companies to reimburse all health care practitioners at the same rate for cervical cytology screening, including the preparation of a Pap smear; prohibits health care practitioners from refusing to provide a Pap smear during a regular annual checkup if such patient has not had a Pap smear done in the preceding twelve months.
LawCode: Amd §§3216, 3221 & 4303, Ins L; amd §364-j, Soc Serv L; add Art 2 Title 6 §266-a, Pub Health L
ActClause: AN ACT to amend the insurance law, the social services law and the public health law, in relation to requiring insurance companies to reimburse all health care practitioners at the same rate for cervical cytology screening
